page.title: 12CHANGING TIMES,SPARSHOLT.
page.content: We interviewed Mrs. Stockwell who has lived in Sparsholt all her life.She was born in 1902 and came to the local school in 1907,she left at the age of 14.She then worked at the local post office,which was built in 1875 and closed in 1985,in between those years Mrs.Stockwell's great grandmother was the first person to sell stamps in Sparsholt. If you wanted to go into Winchester you had to walk,but now you can go by bus,car or bike.Mrs.Stockwell's father used to be the village baker and the bread was delivered in a pony trap. Next door to the old post office is the well house which was built in 1897 for Queen Victoria's Jubilee.Before the village was connected to the mains water supply,the local people had to collect their water from the well house.
